text:
I am implementing a new filter for log4j. The documentation says that the 
methods getOptionStrings() and setOption() are deprecated. This means they 
should (must) not be used. If I do not implement the methods in my filter, I 
get an error message because the methods a part of the OptionHandler interface 
and they have to be implemented. If I do implement the methods, I get 
deprecation warnings. I think this situation is unacceptable from the design 
point of view and has to be resolved. 

I see 2 solutions:
1) The Filter class supplies the dummy implementation of the methods that do 
nothing.
2) The Filter class does not implement the OptionHandler interface at all. This 
solution is preferable because there are no options anymore and filters are 
treated as beans.
